Package controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.UserController

  • public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    The User Controller allows user to manipulate the albums and view albums as a list. Also give functionality to rename albums and open search scene.
    Author:
    Ayush Joshi, Anil Tilve

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.String albumname  
      boolean rename  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserController​()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void handleAddAlbumButton​()
      Handles add button and enables the text field to fill album name.
      void handleCancelButton​()
      Handles the cancel button and confirms with the user to cancel the action.
      void handleConfirmButton​()
      Handles the confirm button and for rename case it will rename the album else it will create a new album and add to the album list for user.
      void handleDeleteAlbumButton​()
      Handles the delete button and deletes the selected album after confirming from user.
      void handleLogOutButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      At any given point the user can logout and it will take user to the main login screen.
      void handleOpenAlbumButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the Open album button and takes the selected album and passes it to Album display after loading the Album Display scene.
      void handleRenameButton​()
      Handles the rename button and loads the current name of the album in the text field for user to modify.
      void handlesearchPhotosButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the search button and loads the search scene for the user.
      void start​(User user, java.util.ArrayList<User> users)
      On Start the user-list and current user is initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​(User user,
                  java.util.ArrayList<User> users)
        On Start the user-list and current user is initialized. And all the albums for the current user are set into list view. As well as Username Label is modified for current user.
        Parameters:
        user - takes the current user.
        users - takes the user list.

      • handleLogOutButton

        public void handleLogOutButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        At any given point the user can logout and it will take user to the main login screen.
        Parameters:
        event - takes the mouse event.

      • handleCancelButton

        public void handleCancelButton​()
        Handles the cancel button and confirms with the user to cancel the action.

      • handleConfirmButton

        public void handleConfirmButton​()
        Handles the confirm button and for rename case it will rename the album else it will create a new album and add to the album list for user. Then save the data using common functionality.

      • handleAddAlbumButton

        public void handleAddAlbumButton​()
        Handles add button and enables the text field to fill album name.

      • handleOpenAlbumButton

        public void handleOpenAlbumButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the Open album button and takes the selected album and passes it to Album display after loading the Album Display scene.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • handleDeleteAlbumButton

        public void handleDeleteAlbumButton​()
        Handles the delete button and deletes the selected album after confirming from user. Then saves the data.

      • handleRenameButton

        public void handleRenameButton​()
        Handles the rename button and loads the current name of the album in the text field for user to modify.

      • handlesearchPhotosButton

        public void handlesearchPhotosButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the search button and loads the search scene for the user.
        Parameters:
        event -
